MrSammich, as far as I can tell TheGroup didn't release that issue. The scan available on here (in http://thepiratebay.sx/torrent/7931625/Teenage_Mutant_Ninja_Turtles_017 ) which was done by Boco, is the only one I can find on any site.

How about a post with the complete Justice League (International, America and Europe) by Keith Giffen and J.M. deMatteis?

I found this one very good: http://thepiratebay.sx/torrent/4479684/Justice_League_International_and_Europe but, unfortunately, it is incomplete.

And, finally, when you have the time, consider posting the JLA Classified issues, if you have them.
Thank you STFmaryville! I found Nightwing's death hilarious. =P

Ahlat you cold-hearted...! nah, it was pretty funny.

i was impressed, however, that taylor's story had hinted so heavily that damian would die only to twist at the end. and i do feel bad for bats, every time robin dies. which this is what-- the 4th time? but the first time it was done by another robin.

ggaanneesshhaa, all of those giffen/dematteis classics are in this excellent torrent:  http://thepiratebay.sx/torrent/6615963/  which also has the first (silver age) justice league of america series.

the same user has another torrent with the entire jla series and jla classified.

Wow! The Justice League torrent is huge! I'll start downloading it right away. Thanks!

And regarding the torrent with the JLA/JLA Classified I think it's dead or stuck at some %. I gonna check it and tell you later, but I believe I already tried it a few months ago.

Finally, thank you again and excuse me if I'm giving you any trouble with my recent requests, ok?

it's no trouble. i try to fill all requests but sometimes it's easier to point you to a torrent already posted.  :-)

i tested http://thepiratebay.sx/torrent/6607085/  with JLA and JLA Classified. right now it has 4 people sharing 100% of the torrent, and i was getting d/l speed of about 7 kB/s. so it may take some time, but it's definitely still seeded.

thx stf. just read it, I really liked what happened for the plot, but not so much the way it went down. it was weird to see a superhero go out in such a pedestrian way, but I guess it had to be some freak accident to work. still one of my favorite currents, and that mislead was cool. that superman/grundy panel was just plain awesome btw
Um... wow. I feel that Nightwing was totally disrespected. It's a shame the writers were so lazy with this issue.

i don't mean to sound condescending, but as silly as the way it happened was, one thing that *might* be overlooked is that it was foreshadowed in robin & nightwing's first appearance(s) in this series. (the scene was in the batcave, a few issues ago.)

but hey, you're right, it's a borderline disrespectful/absurd scene and it's certainly a different way to approach a major death. i look forward to seeing how they deal with it.  :-)

I don't take it that way at all, but ya, I caught how that added to damian's disbelief/horror. I have nothing against them, but i'm not especially attached to any of the bat-hangers-on, plus this is alternate. it was just way less climactic than all the build-up had me expecting. i'll give it to for being unexpected, and I still think it's great for the overall story
Thanks alot, STFmaryville.
